result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

10:03 AM Defendant Amy Lynn Lew in court.  Prosecuting attorney Brenda L. Yaskal in court for the State of Wisconsin. Cases called: 22 CF 519 and 22 CF 384, Atty Yaskal states no offer was given as defendant is requesting counsel, Court reviews petition for appointment of counsel, appoints Attorney Mark Lawton at the rate of $100.00 per hour, defendant to reimburse Columbia County at the rate of $100.00 per month, commencing 11/1/22, matter to be reset for pretrial/return date

1:20 PM Cases called: 22CF519 and 22CF384. Defendant Amy Lynn Lew appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Allison J Borsheim appeared by video for Amy Lynn Lew.  Prosecuting attorney Margeret Anne Sorrentino in court for the State of Wisconsin. Waived reading of complaints. Reason for missed appearance in 22CF384. Bond recommendations. Warrant quashed in 22CF384. Court set $250.00 cash bond. Prior conditions remain. In 22CF519 $500.00 cash bond. Not possess or consume controlled substances without a valid Rx. Not possess drug paraphernalia. Standard felony conditions. Time limits for preliminary hearing waived.
